title: 112_s1154
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Promises to Service-Disabled Veterans Act of 2011". Congress acknowledges the slow progress in meeting the Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans and emphasizes the obligation of federal agencies and prime contractors to comply with the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999. The public has a right to know if the goal is being met. SEC. 3. Transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments are required to submit reports to the Administrator regarding the percentage of prime contracts awarded to these small businesses. The Administrator requires reports on the percentage of prime contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, including subcontractor utilization goals and subcontract values. The report must include the percentage of subcontracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, the weighted average percentage goal negotiated for subcontractor utilization, and the percentage of total contract value awarded to covered contractors by the Executive department. The report must include the percentage of subcontracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans and the percentage of total contract value awarded to covered contractors by the Executive department. Additionally, the Administrator will rank Executive departments based on the percentage of contracts awarded to small business concerns owned by service-disabled veterans. The Administrator will publish a user-friendly, electronically searchable report on a website accessible to the public. It will contain information on prime contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans and the percentage of subcontracts awarded by covered contractors to these small businesses. The Administrator will publish a user-friendly, electronically searchable report on a website accessible to the public containing information submitted under paragraph (2) and rankings made under paragraph (3), with updates not less frequently than quarterly. If national security is at risk, information may be exempt from publication. Additionally, reports to Congress will be provided. The Administrator will update a website quarterly with information on progress towards Government-wide contracting goals. Annual reports to Congress will include a review of the website's data and recommendations for recognized prime contractors. The Administrator will update a website quarterly with the latest data reported by Executive departments. A recommendation for a prime contractor excelling in contracting with service-disabled veteran-owned small businesses will be included in annual reports to Congress.
